{{About|the actor|the American football coach|Blake Anderson (American football)}} {{Infobox person | name = Blake Anderson | image = | imagesize = | caption = | height = 5 ft 10 in | birth_name = Blake Raymond Anderson | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1984|3|2}} | birth_place = [[Sacramento County, California]], U.S. | years_active = 2006–present | occupation = Actor, comedian, producer, screenwriter | spouse = {{marriage|Rachael "Steak" Finley|2012|2017}} | children = 1 }} '''Blake Raymond Anderson''' (born March 2, 1984) is an American actor, comedian, producer, screenwriter and fashion designer. He was one of the stars and co-creators of the [[Comedy Central]] series ''[[Workaholics]]''. ==Early life== Anderson was born in [[Sacramento County, California]] and attended [[Clayton Valley Charter High School|Clayton Valley High School]] in [[Concord, California]]. He was ridiculed for his curly hair, so he shaved it off in 1998 due to peer pressure.{{cite web|url=http://www.mailordercomedy.com/bios.html |title=Bios |publisher=Mail Order Comedy |date=2011-04-06 |accessdate=2012-09-02}} He later moved to [[Los Angeles]] to work with [[improvisational theatre|improvisational comedy troupes]] such as [[The Groundlings]] and [[Upright Citizens Brigade]].{{cite web|title=Blake Anderson's Bio|url=http://www.comedycentral.com/press/bios/blakeanderson.jhtml?print=true|publisher=Comedy Central|accessdate=17 September 2013}} While working as a pizza delivery driver, he attended [[Orange Coast College]] in [[Costa Mesa, California|Costa Mesa]], where he met future co-star [[Adam DeVine]].{{cite web|url=http://www.rollogrady.com/rollo-grady-interview-blake-anderson-of-workaholics/|title=Rollo & Grady Interview :: Blake Anderson of Workaholics|author=Rollo|author2=Grandy|last-author-amp=yes|date=September 2, 2011|work=RolloGrandy.com|accessdate=2013-09-30}} ==Career== In 2006, Anderson formed the sketch comedy group Mail Order Comedy with [[Anders Holm]], [[Adam DeVine]], and [[Kyle Newacheck]]. He appeared on several episodes of the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] show ''[[Traffic Light (TV series)|Traffic Light]]'' and has had small cameos in an episode of [[HBO]]'s ''[[Entourage (U.S. TV series)|Entourage]]''. He was also in National Lampoon's ''The Legend of Awesomest Maximus'' (2009) and an episode of the Fox show ''[[House (TV series)|House]]''. He has appeared on many [[YouTube]] shows such as ''Mail Order Comedy'' (for which he writes and produces all of the material) and ''Dungeon of the Nutsack''. He starred on the Comedy Central show ''[[Workaholics]]'' between 2011 and 2017. He has had roles on ''[[Community (TV series)|Community]]'', ''[[Arrested Development (TV series)|Arrested Development]]'', and ''[[Loiter Squad]]''. He also tours the country to perform his stand-up comedy. In June 2016 it was announced that Anderson, Devine, Holm and Newacheck are working on a film with [[Seth Rogen]] as producer.{{cite web | url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/workaholics-creators-seth-rogen-team-901191 | title=Workaholics Creators, Seth Rogen Team for Action Comedy 'Game Over, Man! | first=Borys | last=Kit | work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] | date=2016-06-09 | accessdate=2018-03-29}} He has also created the fashion line Teenage.{{cite web | url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2014/05/blake-anderson-of-workaholics-and-wife-team-up-for.html | title=Blake Anderson of Workaholics and Wife Team Up for '90s-Vibe T-Shirt Line | first=Lauren | last=Kilberg | date=2014-05-20 | publisher=[[Paste (magazine)|Paste]] | accessdate=2018-03-29}} ==Personal life== Anderson is an avid fan of the hip-hop music scene in the [[East Bay (San Francisco Bay Area)|East Bay]] area, noting [[Lil B]] as one of his favorite performers.{{cite web|last=Evers |first=Derek |url=http://www.imposemagazine.com/features/workaholics-blake-anderson |title=Workaholic Blake Anderson | Bothering |publisher=Impose Magazine |date=2011-05-11 |accessdate=2012-09-02}} Anderson is a [[Golden State Warriors]] fan. On December 17, 2011, Anderson required surgery after [[Spinal fracture|fracturing his spine]] during a house party by jumping from his roof onto a [[beer pong]] table.{{cite news|author=AMANDA MIKELBERG |url=http://articles.nydailynews.com/2011-12-24/news/30552784_1_spinal-surgery-anders-holm-spine |title=WATCH: 'Workaholics’ star fractures spine after jumping from roof - New York Daily News |publisher=Articles.nydailynews.com |date=2011-12-24 |accessdate=2012-09-02}}{{cite news|last=Durante|first=Thomas|title='I got painkillers flowing... I'm all good': Workaholics star Blake Anderson breaks his back after plunging from roof onto beer pong table|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2078036/Workaholics-star-Blake-Anderson-breaks-plunging-roof-beer-pong-table.html|publisher=Daily Mail|accessdate=17 September 2013|location=London|date=2011-12-23}} On September 7, 2012, Anderson married Rachael Finley.{{cite web|author=PUBLIC RECORD |url=http://25.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_mc0jfpCckp1rtgfpvo1_1280.jpg |title=image}} They have one daughter, Mars Ilah Anderson, born in 2014.{{cite web|last=Webber |first=Stephanie|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-moms/news/blake-anderson-workaholics-star-welcomes-baby-girl-mars-ilah-with-wife-rachael-finley--201483|title=Blake Anderson, Workaholics Star, Welcomes Baby Girl Mars Ilah With Wife Rachael Finley|publisher=Us Weekly|date=2014-03-08}} The couple divorced in 2017.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-4563926/Workaholics-actor-Blake-Anderson-wife-split.html|title=Workaholics actor Blake Anderson and wife split|publisher=|accessdate=16 June 2017}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year !! Title !! Peaches & Timberlee [OFFICIAL HD VIDEO]|first=|last=majorlazer|date=19 August 2013|publisher=|accessdate=16 June 2017|via=YouTube}} |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.mailordercomedy.com/ Official website of Mail Order Comedy] * {{IMDb name|2981935}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Anderson, Blake}} [[Category:1984 births]] [[Category:American male comedians]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Male actors from Sacramento, California]] [[Category:People from Concord, California]] [[Category:Orange Coast College alumni]] [[Category:American television writers]] [[Category:Male television writers]] [[Category:American television producers]] [[Category:Writers from California]] [[Category:21st-century American male actors]] [[Category:Comedians from California]] {{US-comedian-stub}}
